channel.title: I need help. i'm tired of asking this everyday and i get no answers
channel.description:
[b][u]CAN SOMEONE PLEASE TELL ME IN A RETARD FRIENDLY WAY HOW TO MAKE A NPC WALK CORRECTLY.[/u][/b]
SOMEBODY PLEASE TELL ME. I'VE BEEN LITERALLY ASKING ALL DAY.

item.title: I need help. i'm tired of asking this everyday and i get no answers
item.dc:creator: @Lank_O Lank O
item.description:
@Lank_O wrote:

i believe its the northeastern most x and y and the southwestern most x and y

north is x1, y1

south is x2,y2

item.title: I need help. i'm tired of asking this everyday and i get no answers
item.dc:creator: @Lank_O Lank O
item.description:
@Lank_O wrote:

i just told you, range x1,y1,x2,y2 are the coordinates where the npc walks, ok i’ll give you an example hold on.

//------NpcID---CoordX--CoordY--Height--RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2-WalkType-Descrption spawn = 2026 3565 3286 0 3577 3300 3573 3296 2 Dharok

item.title: I need help. i'm tired of asking this everyday and i get no answers
item.dc:creator: @Ii_1337_iI Ii 1337 iI
item.description:
@Ii_1337_iI wrote:

[quote=“Lank O, post:2, topic:146487”]alright, in autospawn.cfg you have where your npcs are at correct?

rangex1 , y1, x2, and y2 are the coordinates that your npc will be walking.
just test and re-test on where you want them to walk, im not going to baby feed it to you.[/quote]
omg, ANY retard knows that. i really just need someone to give me a damn example explained to me b/c i cannot keep up with coding and having to deal with school its one or the other, so somebody please just help.

Read full topic
